description: Retrieves detailed information about the ruleset.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the ruleset to be described.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the ruleset.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the ruleset.

nested_items.name: TargetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a resource (dataset) that the ruleset is associated with.

nested_items.name: Rules
nested_items.description: A list of rules that are defined with the ruleset. A rule includes one or more checks to be validated on a DataBrew dataset.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the rule.

nested_items.name: Disabled
nested_items.description: A value that specifies whether the rule is disabled. Once a rule is disabled, a profile job will not validate it during a job run. Default value is false.

nested_items.name: CheckExpression
nested_items.description: The expression which includes column references, condition names followed by variable references, possibly grouped and combined with other conditions. For example, (:col1 starts_with :prefix1 or :col1 starts_with :prefix2) and (:col1 ends_with :suffix1 or :col1 ends_with :suffix2). Column and value references are substitution variables that should start with the --:' symbol. Depending on the context, substitution variables' values can be either an actual value or a column name. These values are defined in the SubstitutionMap. If a CheckExpression starts with a column reference, then ColumnSelectors in the rule should be null. If ColumnSelectors has been defined, then there should be no column reference in the left side of a condition, for example, is_between :val1 and :val2.

nested_items.name: SubstitutionMap
nested_items.description: The map of substitution variable names to their values used in a check expression. Variable names should start with a --:' (colon). Variable values can either be actual values or column names. To differentiate between the two, column names should be enclosed in backticks, for example, ":col1": "`Column A`".
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: The threshold used with a non-aggregate check expression. Non-aggregate check expressions will be applied to each row in a specific column, and the threshold will be used to determine whether the validation succeeds.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of a threshold.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of a threshold. Used for comparison of an actual count of rows that satisfy the rule to the threshold value.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: Unit of threshold value. Can be either a COUNT or PERCENTAGE of the full sample size used for validation.

nested_items.name: ColumnSelectors
nested_items.description: List of column selectors. Selectors can be used to select columns using a name or regular expression from the dataset. Rule will be applied to selected columns.

nested_items.name: Regex
nested_items.description: A regular expression for selecting a column from a dataset.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of a column from a dataset.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the ruleset was created.

nested_items.name: CreatedBy
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user who created the ruleset.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedBy
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user who last modified the ruleset.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The modification date and time of the ruleset.

nested_items.name: ResourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ruleset.
(string) ---
(string) ---
